true its not my sale,  its not your sale either so giving your thought process would not be needed using your logic....

Are you freaking kidding me? I wouldn't even expect Bill to do that. What the Hell is your problem??

[quote name="CMIZ5290" post=1515000]Are you freaking kidding me? I wouldn't even expect Bill to do that. What the Hell is your problem?? It sounds like you have little man's syndrome....[/QUOTE]

You did say

"These are all fair prices in my opinion. I would love to buy the Chase right now...."

I have pulled off ebay listings mid auction to sell a card,  why are you mentioning a little man's syndrom when you are the one that raised a mighty tone with 'WHAT THE HELL IS YOUR PROBLEM'  

what did i say that would of been so upsetting and for you to disparage me, all i said is you could buy the card if you wanted too...geeeez

i guess you no longer love to buy the card ..you could always ask and not speak for someone else on what you expect them to do......

lesser things have been attempted by people that LOVE to get a card....
Jake -- take it from a friend -- the BST is supposed to be a place where people just list cards.  I think most people view it as not cool when you comment on the cards for sale, their prices, etc.

[quote name="1952boyntoncollector" post=1514951]true its not my sale,  its not your sale either so giving your thought process would not be needed using your logic....[/QUOTE]

It is against the rules to comment in BST threads with prices, comments which talk about price, value etc......  It's one of the few rules in the BST areas but it makes sense. Your first comment was unnecessary in this thread. It's not the end of the world though.....happy collecting

[quote name="CMIZ5290" post=1514718]These are all fair prices in my opinion. I would love to buy the Chase right now....[/QUOTE]

Chase sold for around 10 dollars under asking price...im sure you bought the Chase given your comment...    Leon..sorry for comment on B/S/T but my first comment was AFTER they were sent to ebay...so the B/S/T thread really was closed...it wasnt an active listing..plus this current comment is after the cards have sold on ebay.......just making a point...not trying to ruffle feathers..and again its not on an active listing.(you rarely see me comment on an active listing but I think you will agree you see others talk all the time on mine..)..would like to see the card cmize bought as he LOVED the card ..

Were the initial prices fair prices?

It seems on this board that a fair price is the price that the card would sell on eBay.

I would say that forazzurri2axz is extremely fair with his opening prices, considering that the total prices of all the cards sold for $2088 on eBay. His prices added up to $2085 and all cards were within the "margin of error" individually.

I think that his offers were amazingly accurate of the current trends on eBay.

Cy

[quote name="Cy2009" post=1517474]Were the initial prices fair prices?

It seems on this board that a fair price is the price that the card would sell on eBay.

I would say that forazzurri2axz is extremely fair with his opening prices, considering that the total prices of all the cards sold for $2088 on eBay. His prices added up to $2085 and all cards were within the "margin of error" individually.

I think that his offers were amazingly accurate of the current trends on eBay.

Cy[/QUOTE]

agreed..plus no chance to lose on ebay by 5 dollars last second..thats worth a few dollars.....sellers usually like to sell for a few percent less than ebay and save the fees but that usually only really matters on the bigger money cards..
